subject: History
title: Enigma and Alan Turing
description: A quick, practical guide to Enigma and Alan Turing.

hook.text: Germany believed its Enigma cipher machine was unbreakable. A quiet mathematician proved them catastrophically wrong.

buildup.text: Enigma could produce 159 quintillion possible settings. Changing the key daily made brute force impossible.

discovery.text: At Bletchley Park, Alan Turing built the Bombeâ€”a machine that tested Enigma settings thousands of times faster.

twist.text: Breaking Enigma was kept secret for 30 years. Turing received no public credit during his lifetime.

climax.text: Historians estimate cracking Enigma shortened WWII by two years and saved millions of lives.

punchline.text: One man's machine may have saved more lives than any general.

quiz.question: What machine did Turing build to crack the Enigma cipher?
